name: Générer des briefs de contenu SEO basés sur la recherche avec OpenAI et Firecrawl vers Google Docs
description:
Pour qui
------------

Équipes de contenu/SEO qui souhaitent un brief rapide, cohérent et basé sur la recherche pour des rédacteurs à partir d'un seul mot-clé—sans révision manuelle et analyse des SERP (résultats Google).

Comment ça fonctionne / Ce que ça fait
---------------------------

- Le déclencheur de formulaire collecte le mot-clé/sujet et redirige vers le dossier Google Drive après le dernier nœud.
- FireCrawl Search & Scrape extrait les 5 meilleures pages pour le mot-clé choisi.
- L'agent IA (avec Think + modèle de chat OpenAI) analyse les sources et génère un brief Markdown original.
- Markdown to JSON convertit le Markdown en requêtes batchUpdate Google Docs (H1/H2/H3, listes, liens, espacement). Ensuite, cela est utilisé dans Mettre à jour un document pour mettre à jour le document vide.
- Créer un document + Mettre à jour un document écrit un Google Doc intitulé “Brief SEO pour ” et met à jour le Google Doc dans votre dossier Drive cible.

Comment configurer
-------------

1.  Ajouter des identifiants : Firecrawl (en-tête d'autorisation), OpenAI (Chat), Google Docs OAuth2.
2.  Remplacer les espaces réservés : {{APIKEY}}, {{googledrivefolderid}}, {{googledrivefolderurl}}.
3.  Publier et ouvrir l'URL du formulaire pour tester.

Exigences
------------

Clé API Firecrawl • Clé API OpenAI • Compte Google avec accès au dossier Drive cible.

Ressources
---------

Configuration des identifiants Google OAuth2 - [https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-generic/](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-generic/)  
Clé API Firecrawl - [https://take.ms/lGcUp](https://take.ms/lGcUp)  
Clé API OpenAI - [https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/openai/](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/openai/)

workflow.name: Create keyword-to-Google Docs research-backed SEO content brief

parameters.formTitle: VertoDigital Keyword to SEO Content Brief

values.html:
Enter the primary keyword or topic for the content brief. This should represent the main focus of the SEO-optimized content you want to create. Once completed, you'll be redirected to a Google Drive folder containing your generated SEO content brief.

Here is how the workflow works:

  1. Firecrawl searches the web for your keyword and scrapes the top 5 relevant pages (main content only).
  2. GPT AI Agent (with Think) analyzes the sources and generates the content brief in Markdown.
  3. The Markdown brief is converted and formatted for Google Docs.
  4. A Google Doc titled “SEO Brief for <Keyword>” is created and populated.
  5. You are redirected to the Google Drive folder containing your SEO content brief.

parameters.text:
=Here is the topic for the blog post:

<topic>
{{ $('On form submission').item.json['Keyword/Topic'] }}
</topic>

Below are the top-ranking pages and their content for the target keyword. For each source, you'll find the content and its corresponding URL:


<source_content_1>
{{ $json.data.web[0].markdown }}
<source_content_1>

<source_url_1>
{{ $json.data.web[0].url }}
<source_url_1>

<source_content_2>
{{ $json.data.web[1].markdown }}
<source_content_2>

<source_url_2>
{{ $json.data.web[1].url }}
<source_url_2>

<source_content_3>
{{ $json.data.web[2].markdown }}
<source_content_3>

<source_url_3>
{{ $json.data.web[2].url }}
<source_url_3>

<source_content_4>
{{ $json.data.web[3].markdown }}
<source_content_4>

<source_url_4>
{{ $json.data.web[3].url }}
<source_url_4>

<source_content_5>
{{ $json.data.web[4].markdown }}
<source_content_5>

<source_url_5>
{{ $json.data.web[4].url }}
<source_url_5>

Your task is to analyze these sources and create a unique, comprehensive content brief that incorporates best practices and insights from top-ranking content. Focus on providing valuable insights and a fresh perspective on the given topic while incorporating SEO best practices.

Before creating the content brief, use think tool and make a strategy and analysis. In your analysis, consider the following:

1. For each source:
   - List 3-5 key points
   - Note any unique angles or perspectives
   - Identify potential content gaps

2. Compare and contrast the sources:
   - Identify common themes across all sources (list at least 3)
   - Note any conflicting information or viewpoints (if any)
   - Highlight unique elements in each source

3. Brainstorm 5 unique angles or perspectives not covered in the existing sources. Number each idea as you list it.

4. Determine 3-5 content gaps and areas for improvement or expansion across all sources

5. Outline 5 key SEO strategies to be implemented

6. Suggest 3 visual or interactive content ideas that could enhance the article

7. List 10 questions that the content should aim to answer. Number each question as you list it.

8. Propose an overall approach to make the content competitive with top-ranking pages, including 5 specific strategies and tactics

After your analysis, develop the content brief using the following structure:

Content Brief for {{ $('On form submission').item.json['Keyword/Topic'] }}
(H1) [Optimized Title] (5-10 words)

Target Keywords: [List primary keywords]
Secondary Keywords: [List secondary keywords]

Introduction Guidelines: [2-3 sentences outlining the introduction]

Content Structure:
[H2] [Section Title]
- [H3] [Subsection Title]
  [Content guidelines and key points to cover]
- [H3] [Subsection Title]
  [Content guidelines and key points to cover]

[H2] [Section Title]
- [H3] [Subsection Title]
  [Content guidelines and key points to cover]
- [H3] [Subsection Title]
  [Content guidelines and key points to cover]

[Continue with additional H2 and H3 sections as needed]

SEO Recommendations:
- Semantic keywords: [List relevant semantic keywords]
- Word count: [Recommended word count range]
- Technical requirements: [Specific technical SEO recommendations]

Top-Ranking References: [List the provided URLs]

Additional Content Guidelines:
- [List any additional guidelines or requirements]

Source Overview:
[Provide a 4-5 sentence overview summarizing key insights from all sources]


The final format should be only a markdown with the content brief.

Requirements:
1. Include all major aspects of the topic in your content structure.
2. Suggest at least one to three visual representation of a key concept related to the topic.
3. If relevant, compare the main topic to a related concept or model.
4. Total word count should be based on best SEO practices and the content lenght - n words.
5. Incorporate semantic keywords naturally throughout the content brief.
6. Identify opportunities for featured snippets, internal linking, and FAQs where relevant.
7. Include the provided source URLs in the "Top-ranking references" section of the SEO Recommendations.
8. Provide a concise 5-10 sentence overview of all sources at the end of the brief.
9. 9. Everything should be in markdown format. Never write ```markdown in the beginning and ```\n at the end, just start with the content.

Remember to create a unique and comprehensive brief that goes beyond summarizing the existing content. Your goal is to provide a strategy for creating content that can compete with and surpass the top-ranking pages. The content structure provided is an example; adapt it as necessary for the specific topic given.

options.systemMessage: You are an expert content strategist and SEO specialist tasked with creating a comprehensive content brief for a blog post. Your goal is to analyze top-ranking content on a given topic and create a detailed outline that will help produce high-quality, SEO-optimized content that can compete with and surpass the top-ranking pages.

parameters.content:
## 🟨 Overview — Create SEO content brief from keyword to Google Docs

## Who’s it for
Content/SEO teams who want a fast, consistent, research-driven brief for a copywriters from a single keyword—without manual review and analysis of the SERP (Google results).

## How it works / What it does
- **Form Trigger** collects the keyword/topic and redirects to Google Drive Folder after the final node.  
- **FireCrawl Search & Scrape** pulls the top 5 pages for the chosen keyword.  
- **AI Agent** (with **Think** + **OpenAI Chat Model**) analyzes sources and generates an **original Markdown** brief.  
- **Markdown to JSON** converts the Markdown into Google Docs `batchUpdate` requests (H1/H2/H3, lists, links, spacing). Then this is used in **Update a document** for updating the empty doc.
- **Create a document** + **Update a document** write a Google Doc titled **“SEO Brief for <keyword>”** and update the Google Doc in your target Drive folder.

## How to set up
1) Add credentials: **Firecrawl** (Authorization header), **OpenAI** (Chat), **Google Docs OAuth2**.  
2) Replace placeholders: `{{API_KEY}}`, `{{google_drive_folder_id}}`, `{{google_drive_folder_url}}`.  
3) Publish and open the Form URL to test.

## Requirements
Firecrawl API key • OpenAI API key • Google account with access to the target Drive folder.

## Resources
Google OAuth2 Credentials Setup - https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-generic/
Firecrawl API key - https://take.ms/lGcUp
OpenAI API key - https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/openai/

## 🗒️ Setup checklist (do these before first run)

- **On form submission → Respond with redirect**: set `={{google_drive_folder_url}}`.  
- **Create a document → folderId**: set `={{google_drive_folder_id}}`.  
- **FireCrawl headers**: `Authorization: Bearer {{API_KEY}}`.  
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: attach your OpenAI credential.  
- **Google Docs OAuth2**: attach to both Docs nodes - Create a document + Update a document. 
- Test with a keyword (e.g., `GEO strategy`) and verify the created Doc & redirect.

user.name: Simeon Penev
user.bio: I specialize in building AI workflows that streamline processes and reduce manual work. My main workflows are in the marketing field, but I can automate all kind of processes and integrate AI in them.
